WRITING.TITLE: DEA think the fat-acceptance movement is basically the same thing as the pro-ana movement?
WRITING.TEXT:
In essence...
Both advocate and promote unhealthy bodies (Pro-Ana promotes super-skinny, malnourished bodies and eating too little, FA promotes super-sized bodies receiving poor nutrition and eating too much)
Both glorify eating disorders (Pro-Ana glorifies anorexia nervous and FA glorifies bing eating disorder)
They both treat deadly habits as lifestyle choices (Pro-Ana treats it like a hobby, a game, a status symbol, a club, a beauty routine, FA treats it like an identity, a cute quirk, and as a natural thing)
The only real difference is that society is quickly accepting Fat-Acceptance, HAES, etc, and demonizing Pro-Ana even though *both* should not be treated as what they are- movements that help each other destroy their bodies and pat each other on the back for it.

I never understood that one. I was anorexic for two ears and only ever baked for binges before purging. I also didn't have poor body image or self-esteem issues. My thoughts were basically "I'm too perfect to ruin myself with food". I guess I'm off though.

This is utter bullshit. 1) She thinks she understand eating disorders but proved that she doesn't by ignoring *actual* eating disorder symptoms and habits or just staring stereotypes.
2) She totally ignored the fact that straight men get eating disorders too.
3) She thinks healthy eating and exercise is *literally anorexia*

I absolutely cannot stand when people say they are "triggered" by things like this. A doctor informing you you having a medical condition (being fat) and should follow the treatment (healthy eating, less eating, more exercise) and you being offended by it is not "triggering". Triggered is when you experience sensory information that reminds you of a traumatic experience that may cause intense emotional distress, flashbacks, and physical symptoms. It is not "*zomg a doctor told me how to be healthy and it hurt my feelz*
Canada.
At least that's something.
Yes.
It's things like that that make me embarrassed to be American. Child pageants. It's sick.
